parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions the PNCR (Partidul Național Conservator Român) and implicitly promotes the candidate Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop, whose Facebook page is linked to the ad.  The images show the candidate with other individuals, distributing campaign materials. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The message is not a private communication but a public appeal. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support the PNCR and, by implication, Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop. Phrases like "Votează schimbarea reală!", "Împreună ducem Pecica în Parlament!", and the visual of the candidate distributing campaign materials clearly aim to influence voting behavior. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post mentions discussing community issues, its core message is overtly promotional and lacks the objectivity expected of journalistic reporting. The focus is on advocating for a specific candidate and party, not providing neutral information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it promotes a political candidate and party. The call to action is explicitly electoral in nature.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>542786071898985</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, with its paid promotion, clear identification of a parliamentary candidate (Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop) and the PNCR party, and explicit calls to vote for them, constitutes electoral propaganda. The images further reinforce this by showing the candidate actively campaigning. The post's objective is undeniably to influence voters in favor of the PNCR and its candidate.  The fact that the post was published after the official campaign period ended (end_date: 1732953600 corresponds to November 23rd, 2024, after 6 PM) is a significant factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Pop Sebastian Tiberiu, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 542786071898985), cu cheltuieli de publicitate sub 100 RON, ce conține imagini cu candidatul distribuind materiale electorale și îndemnuri explicite la vot pentru PNCR și candidatul Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop, având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea acestuia.  Postarea, cu fraze precum „Votează schimbarea reală!”, „Împreună ducem Pecica în Parlament!”, și imaginile atașate, depășește limitele activității jurnalistice și constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei electorale, conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  Postarea a atins o audiență estimată la peste 1 milion de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library, cu contactul advertiserului disponibil la contact@sebastiantiberiupop.ro și +40760256257.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
